heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 19 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.8 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 222 m) and rainfall (up 0.8 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.1 mm) and cloud levels (up 889 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 222.3m lower than yesterday, 607.6m lower than the past week, 888.8m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 572m to 1380m and averaged 673.8m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Fog or low cloud is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, air moisture should feel ok and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, fog or low cloud is expected, and it’s dim outside. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
